comment: She's pretty difficult to understand when it comes to what she wants, BUT as long as you keep asking her about your work and do exactly what she tells you, you will be fine. Keep it more simple than you think. Her grading is strange but she's actually a very nice person.

Great professor! Assignments may not be clear initially but if you ask questions she almost always clears it up. Strict with attendance and grading scale but fantastic person to just talk to. Also if you're struggling with a design she is more than willing to help. Not a bad professor, some people need to realize they're not in high school.

Worst teacher! More Homework & harder class than any other class Ive taken. Her attendance policy is ridiculous. 4 absences and drop a grade no doctor excuses aloud. Her grading scale is ridiculous GRADING SCALE: A= 95 - 100,  B= 88 - 94,  C= 76 - 87,  D= 65 - 75,  F = below 65. I have been told Im very talented but she is making me rethink art.

Horrible woman. attempted to fail me when i got chicken pox and was kicked off campus, even though everything was turned in on time.This teacher is a nightmare, very cold and filled with snide remarks.

I was really looking forward to this class but it ended up being my least favorite because of this professor. She's very unclear of what she wants and if it's not what she's imagining in her head, it's wrong. The grading system is absurd and makes it very hard to get an A (95-100 = A). I would recommend taking a different professor.

Professor Miles is a very strict woman. She does not give hardly any artistic freedom. She wants you to produce exactly what's in her head, which is hard to figure out. I don't recommend her at all. She will make you seriously consider whether art is really worth it or not. :(

She can be nice, usually rude though.  Don't come in late, she'll call you out in front of the class like you're a child. Don't apologize for being late/absent. She'll say she doesn't want your apologies. Very unclear about very specific guidelines. Literally said "I don't know how to make this any simpler" when someone asked reasonable questions.

She's awful, but this class is required for entry level art students. Go in to the class with an open mind and be prepared to not create anything you like. You have ZERO artistic freedom. Don't talk in her class and act like you love her and you'll do fine. Agree with everything she says about your work and you'l get along great. Don't argue w/her.

Must be there for letures, miss and day means you miss a whole chapter. give you way more info then you need for test, just pay close attention during reviews. Had no art knowledge prior to class. Actually learned quite abit. Instuctions are confusing at times, but her test and project are fair and to the point. Challenging but very fair!

Prof Miles is such a good professor that i have ever met.She will listen to and help any student having difficulties with any topic either in class or on vista.Just tell her what your problem is, she is always ready to help, and never tired to help over and over again. She is simply the best.

Legitimately one of the worst professors I have ever had. Her assignments were unclear, and although she makes you re-draw assignments many times, her suggestions are often unhelpful, and implementing them does not affect your grade positively. If you have to miss class, she is not understanding at all and will not allow make-up work.
Run. Turn and Run.

This is the most frustrating professor I have ever encountered. She is unclear about what she wants, though she's clearly wanting something specific. She counts off for doing things she suggested. She'll devote all her time to some students while ignoring the rest, and often drove me to tears of frustration. I pity all the entry level art majors.

This professor is not clear on what she wants to be done. She will tell you one thing and then  take points off for doing exactly that. Attendance is a must, even though you usually just sit there for two hours because youv already done what is needed in class. She only likes to focus on bland patterns. She took the fun out of art for me.
She was not very clear in her directions. She says one thing and grades differently. Her advice was not helpful and she never liked anything anyone did. No bright colors or small details or you fail.

She is a nice woman, enthusiastic about the material, and willing to discuss the projects. When it comes to teaching, though, she's not good for an entry level class. She is one of those professors who think the material is easy and there is no way you couldn't get it. Also, a 93 in her class is a B, so she's tough on grading.

Professor Miles is very enthusiastic. She encourages participation, and wants to know what you think.  However, she takes it very personally when people don't come to class, even though she does not require attendance, because she does not understand the lack of motivation to learn. She provides study guides and gives multiple choice exams. Easy A.

Best professor ever!! Sometimes she can be confusing with what she wants with a design but gives you the chance to fix your projects for higher grade. I loved her and she was so helpful!! I suggest everyone take her if possible!! You can make an easy grade if you asked questions, do the work and take the chance to fix your grades! She's an A+++++

She's a tough teacher. But I think most problems people have come from not liking the curriculum rather than Prof Miles. While the class is no cake-walk, I wouldn't say she made it difficult to do well. I felt lost a lot, but ended up with a low A. She's not as bad as you think. She does her best to help unless you give her a reason not to.

Infuriating teacher. You never know what she expects from you in design or in generally preparing for class. This class is a lot of work! No matter what you draw, she'll make you change redraw it at least 3 times. She pretty much ends up drawing all your projects for you. She's very critical and can be really harsh and hurt your feelings. Caution!

A hard teacher for an entry level class. A nice lady when it comes to conversation, but is a really tough grader and expects a lot. I don't understand why they put her as an entry level teacher. She let's you redo your projects to make up points sometimes, though, which is a plus. She hates electronics to be used. She's alright, just challenging.

Fast paced! While other professors are still working lines and B/W, she's already on color projects and giving u problems to solve with design.  Worried in preparing for job market.  Wants to help.  Hard tests, but depending on class, will give again.  Primes for quality, but fun, and again, very professional.  Would take her in any class.
